titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Fales Library Events Video Collection
1990-2016
MSS.307
titlestmt.author: Ashley Todd, Esti Brennan, 2011.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-08-19 15:49:24 UTC.

change.item: Record edited by Anna Bj√∂rnsson McCormick to reflect the rehousing of materials
Updated by Weatherly Stephan to clarify availability of access copies

did.unittitle: Fales Library Events Video Collection

physdesc.extent: in 3 record cartons, 4 manuscript boxes, 1 card box, and 2 shared boxes

did.physloc: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Fales Library Events Video Collection contains video and audio of events either arranged by or held at the Fales Library relating to the Fales Library, Fales archival collections and/or the Fales Food Studies Series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is divided into three series:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Fales Library Events Video Collection; MSS 307; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains video and audio of events either arranged by or held at Fales Library.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Access to audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room. Access copies are avaialble in Series I and II of the collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2025 are unknown. In 2025, media previously located on open shelving was placed in archival boxes.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional collection material is added regularly.
